column22: [to be refined by Comms team]. The total one-off cost of imprisoning a single person in the UK is £40,000, plus £4,000 for every further year of incarceration. Cost savings to the MoJ have therefore been calculated at £44m if the SIB performs at target levels
column23: the One* Service consists of five charitable service providers and a number of other organisations that are engage as and when required. Working with offenders both pre- and post-release, it provides a holistic service including housing, training and employment, parenting, substance abuse, and mental health support. The service aims to reduce the reconviction rate of the target population relative to a matched comparison group. Each member of the intervention cohort is matched with (x) offenders with similar characteristics and offending histories
column24: Investors receive outcomes payments if reconviction rate falls by 10% for each cohort, or by 7.5% over the four years of the project. Returns increase incrementally if the reconviction rate reduces beyond these levels, with maximum outcomes payments equivalent to a 13% investor return
column25: Results from the independent evaluator, released in August 2014, demonstrated an 8.4% reduction in reconviction rate for the first cohort of prisoners relative to the matched comparison group. Investors are on course to receive a payment in 2016, and based on the trend in performance, can expect to receive their capital plus a positive return.
